name: NSTouch.Phase
desc: The possible phases of a touch.

items.name: init(rawValue: UInt)
items.desc: Creates a new touch phase from the given raw value.

items.name: static var began: NSTouch.Phase
items.desc: A finger touched the device. Or, a resting touch transitioned to an active touch and resting touches are not wanted by the view hierarchy.

items.name: static var moved: NSTouch.Phase
items.desc: A finger moved on the device.

items.name: static var stationary: NSTouch.Phase
items.desc: A finger is touching the device, but hasn't moved since the previous event.

items.name: static var ended: NSTouch.Phase
items.desc: A finger was lifted from the screen. Or, an active touch transitioned to a resting touch and resting touches are not wanted by the view hierarchy.

items.name: static var cancelled: NSTouch.Phase
items.desc: The system cancelled tracking for the touch, as when (for example) the window associated with the touch resigns key or is deactivated.

items.name: static var touching: NSTouch.Phase
items.desc: Matches the began, moved, or stationary phases of a touch.

items.name: static var any: NSTouch.Phase
items.desc: Matches any phase of a touch.
